title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
An appeals court found the CFPB is funded through an unconstitutional method, a ruling that threw out its regulation on payday lenders and struck a blow against how the agency operates.

Board members at Udemy, SolarWinds and three other public companies resigned in recent weeks because they simultaneously served as directors of competing firms, the Justice Department said.

Major U.S. stock indexes ended lower, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials retreating 0.7%, 0.9% and 0.3%, respectively.

P&G said the stronger dollar erased most of its sales gains for the latest quarter and is on track to lead the company to its first annual sales decline in half a decade.

Philip Morris plans to raise its offer for Swedish Match and has agreed to pay $2.7 billion to regain the U.S. rights for its IQOS heated tobacco products from Altria.

Spirit shareholders voted to approve the airline's merger with JetBlue, a step toward creating the fifth-largest U.S. airline.

What's News: Business & Finance
